thread.title: Democrat Senator Speaks Out Against Gorsuch Filibuster
thread.title_full: Democrat Senator Speaks Out Against Gorsuch Filibuster

author: Jack Davis
title: Democrat Senator Speaks Out Against Gorsuch Filibuster

organizations.name: senate democrats the national rifle association

text:
Democrat Senator Speaks Out Against Gorsuch Filibuster “It’s my duty to fully consider any Supreme Court nominee..." by Jack Davis March 28, 2017 at 4:02pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print   
Two wrongs do not make things right, Sen. Heidi Heitkamp , D-N.D., said this week as she indicated that she did not want to filibuster the Supreme Court nomination of Judge Neil Gorsuch. 
“As I said last year when Judge [Merrick] Garland was nominated — and reiterated again when Judge Gorsuch was nominated — the U.S. Senate should have an up or down vote on any Supreme Court nominee as part of fulfilling our constitutional duty of providing advice and consent on nominees to the Supreme Court,” Heitkamp said in a statement. 
Garland was nominated by then-President Barack Obama after the death of Justice Antonin Scalia last year, but the Republican-controlled Senate never acted on the nomination.   Trump Gives Pentagon More Leeway To Wage War In The Middle East 
Heitkamp said that just because the GOP played politics last year does not give the Democrats license to do the same with Gorsuch. . @inforum I already did. Gorsuch should get hearing & vote just as Garland should have. Sen must fully consider noms https://t.co/9LAYU6XFTQ 
— Sen. Heidi Heitkamp (@SenatorHeitkamp) March 23, 2017 
“It’s my duty to fully consider any Supreme Court nominee, regardless of which party is in the White House — such a role should be above politics,” her statement added.   
Heitkamp did not signal which way she intended to vote. 
She said she is “in the process of reviewing the materials [Gorsuch] submitted and testimony from his hearing” and is considering his record. NRA guns for Gorsuch, targets Tester, McCaskill, Donnelly, Heitkamp https://t.co/CHrYiwHcgy via @DCExaminer 
— Deplorable Jim K (@JimKuther) March 28, 2017 
Heitkamp is among four Senate Democrats the National Rifle Association said it will target with ads in support of Gorsuch. The others are Sens. Claire McCaskill of Missouri, Jon Tester of Montana and Joe Donnelly of Indiana. All four are up for reelection in 2018 and represent states with powerful NRA contingents.
